author: CamberbrickGreen
title: Engineered Rails
review:
Well this is not the most riveting example of a set but is certainly owned or sought by many as an accessory pack or add on to help build railways. 

Live Line
Important for what they do, these come across as very well made. They form a reliable surface for your engineers to use or 'build' in place. The metal feels bolted straight on to tough plastic though care should be taken of such pieces.

The 12V system is still popular and had some great sets. With these rails along with power and the control accessories it really does transform; your railway, Lego landscapes and the whole feeling of the hobby. The electric sets always seemed to come with a particular smell (it wasn't burning dust was it?) and you now had an automatic movement and action with which your people could interact. A heavy industrial machine in most cases and very impressive when trundling around.

These are worth a critical point in that they are chunky but compared to the modern segemented effect railway sleeper I found them preferable.

Straights are the start, you will need all the curves too. Good luck!
